item.title: TAITO Milestones 4 announced for Switch
item.content:encoded:
• Switch

Due out on March 26, 2026 in Japan.

TAITO has announced TAITO Milestones 4 for Switch. It will launch on March 26, 2026 in Japan for 5,720 yen. It will also be released in North America and Europe by Clear River Games.

Titles included in the collection are as follows:

  • Arkanoid
  • Bonze Adventure
  • Cameltry
  • DonDokoDon
  • Field Day
  • Kuri Kinton
  • Syvalion
  • The Ninja Kids
  • Typhoon Gal
  • Water Ski

In Japan, a Famitsu DX Pack will also be available for 11,480 yen, which includes a long-sleeved t-shirt with an original design by EDITMODE, as well as a special CD called “TAITO Sound Milestones 4″ containing select tracks from the featured games and an original sticker.

item.title: Gear.Club Unlimited 3 launches February 19, 2026 for Switch 2, later in 2026 for PS5, Xbox Series, and PC
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Switch 2
  • Xbox Series

A new playground for car enthusiasts.

Racing game Gear.Club Unlimited 3 will launch for Switch 2 on February 19, 2026, followed by PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC later in 2026, publisher Nacon and developer Eden Games announced.

Here is an overview of the game, via Nacon:

A New Playground for Car Enthusiasts

After winning over more than 22 million players worldwide, the Gear.Club franchise returns with an even more ambitious third instalment. Drivers can now race on brand new roads with spectacular views, ranging from the mountains of Japan to the sunny shores of the Mediterranean.

The First Japanese Gear.Club Opens Its Doors

In Gear.Club Unlimited 3, players are invited to settle in Japan to open the country’s very first Gear.Club. Their mission: recruit the best local drivers, assemble teams with the best mechanics and engineers, while immersing themselves in Japan’s unique automotive culture, which is both rich and singular, contrasting with that of other Gear.Clubs. The Story mode will thus be punctuated by trips back and forth between France and Japan, highlighting the shared passion that unites car enthusiasts on both continents.

A New Speed Experience: Highway Mode

Among the major new features, Highway Mode promises unprecedented thrills. At the wheel of dream cars, players will have to push their limits and master pure speed on sections of highway designed for adrenaline. This mode also introduces a real challenge: racing at over 300 km/h through the dense traffic of Japanese highways, maintaining control on long straights at high speed as well as in tight corners where every mistake can be fatal.

The Gear.Club Spirit Remains at the Heart of the Game

True to its DNA, Gear.Club Unlimited 3 retains the elements that made the series so successful:

  • Prestige – A selection of legendary vehicles under official licenses.
  • Customization – Players can customize and upgrade their vehicles to their liking to impose their style on the roads.
  • Adrenaline – More than 50 tracks in France and Japan, with a local split-screen multiplayer mode for two players. Players can compete in races, sprints, or duels, but also cooperate in highway mode for an even more intense shared experience!
  • ❮
  • ❯

Pre-Order Bonuses

To celebrate the announcement of the release date for Gear.Club Unlimited 3 on Nintendo Switch 2, players will be able to enjoy exclusive content thanks to pre-order bonuses and those included in the Deluxe Edition. The Pre-Order Edition will offer two exclusive models, the Honda S2000 Gear.Club Unlimited 3 Edition and the BMW Z4 Gear.Club Unlimited 3 Edition, allowing players to start their adventure behind the wheel of iconic vehicles specially redesigned for the game.

Deluxe Edition

The Deluxe Edition will offer a complete set of benefits, starting with three days of early access. It will also include the “Performance Cars Pack” downloadable content, which adds three prestigious vehicles: the Nissan GTR R-35 Nismo, the Nissan 370Z Nismo, and the Bugatti Mistral.

Players will get a real boost to their progress with the “Career Starter Pack” downloadable content, which includes 200,000 credits, three sets of 50 different resources, and two engineers.

Finally, the “Customization Pack” downloadable content will enhance customization options with a Carbon Pack featuring three carbon hoods for seven Japanese cars—21 pieces in total—and a Neon Pack including five themed neon lights applicable to all cars, including one in the colors of France and one in the colors of Japan.

With rich content, realistic sensations, and accessibility designed for all players, Gear.Club Unlimited 3 promises to be the must-have game for speed enthusiasts on Nintendo Switch 2.

item.title: Dragon Quest VII Reimagined character trailer – Ruff
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Switch 2
  • Xbox Series

A pure-hearted boy accompanied by a wolf.

Square Enix has released the fourth character trailer for Dragon Quest VII Reimagined, introducing Ruff, a pure-hearted boy who is always accompanied by a wolf.

Ruff’s character description reads, “A cheerful, pure-hearted boy who is always accompanied by a wolf. Though sometimes naive, he possesses sharp, animal-like instincts.”

Dragon Quest VII Reimagined is due out for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch 2, Switch, and PC via Steam and Microsoft Store on February 5, 2026 worldwide. Read more about the game here here, and here.
